parameters.name: obj
parameters.description:
A pointer to the atomic object (see the
  atomic_* types)
  whose value you want to OR something with.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description:
The value you want to OR in to the object.
  “M” is either the non-atomic type corresponding to A if A is an atomic integer type, or
  ptrdiff_t if A is an atomic pointer type.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
(atomic_fetch_or_explicit() only) The
  memory_order
  to use for the operation.

full_content:
Function: atomic_fetch_or
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/atomic_fetch_or.html
Synopsis: C atomic_fetch_or_explicit( volatile A *obj,
Headers: #include <stdatomic.h>
Parameters:
  - obj: A pointer to the atomic object (see the
  atomic_* types)
  whose value you want to OR something with.
  - arg: The value you want to OR in to the object.
  “M” is either the non-atomic type corresponding to A if A is an atomic integer type, or
  ptrdiff_t if A is an atomic pointer type.
  - order: (atomic_fetch_or_explicit() only) The
  memory_order
  to use for the operation.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <stdatomic.h>

C atomic_fetch_or( volatile A *obj,
                   M arg );

C atomic_fetch_or_explicit( volatile A *obj,
                            M arg,
                            memory_order order );
